I know some of our small business owners were discouraged when all the answers were not immediately available but I ask you to not lose hope and continue moving forward. I have every confidence that these funds will begin to flow as quickly as possible. #lagov #lalege

This is a very difficult time for everyone, but small businesses should know these funds are available today and Louisiana banks are positioned through the SBA to assist their customers during this crisis. #lagov #lalege

The rollout out of the $349 billion through this program comes at a critical time for our state, but it will not last long as businesses across the country will also apply, which is why our small businesses should not wait to apply. #lagov #lalege

I want to encourage small business owners across the state to immediately apply for assistance with payroll, rent and other operational expenses through the federal Paycheck Protection Program. #lagov #lalege

We know that social distancing efforts work and will, in fact, flatten the curve. I am imploring all of our people to stay home, slow the spread and save lives. #lagov #lalege
However, the degree to which we are able to prevent overwhelming our hospitals depends on people’s compliance of the Stay at Home Order and other mitigation measures. #lagov #lalege

Based on our modeling, we know that we will exceed our capacity to deliver health care, first in the New Orleans area, but because of these ventilators and others that we are sourcing, we will be able to prolong that inevitable day. #lagov #lalege

We are grateful to @POTUS and @VP for keeping Louisiana at the forefront of this fight against COVID-19 and appreciate them understanding the necessity of these ventilators. I spoke to the Vice President this morning and reiterated Louisiana’s ongoing needs. #lagov #lalege

Today, @VP confirmed Louisiana will receive an additional 200 ventilators from the strategic national stockpile in response to the coronavirus pandemic, for a total of 350 ventilators received from the stockpile. #lagov #lalege

ICYMI: Yesterday, I formally extended the Stay at Home order until April 30. It is absolutely critical that each Louisianan take this Stay at Home order seriously. Act as if your life depends on it – because it does. 

Do your part. Stay home. Stop the spread. Save lives. #lagov https://t.co/Htlych5yOJ

The order means you still cannot gather in groups of more than 10 people. Frankly, you shouldn’t be gathering in groups at all. I’d love to see that Louisiana ingenuity put to use in finding ways to connect without being physically together. #lagov #lalege

We have seen federal modeling data that shows that Louisiana could see more than 1,800 deaths by August. It doesn’t have to be that way. By working together, we can help flatten the curve in Louisiana, but we need all of our people to comply with the order. #lagov #lalege

Today, I formally extended the Stay at Home order until April 30, as Louisiana works to slow the spread of COVID-19. It is absolutely critical that each Louisianan take this Stay at Home order seriously. Act as if your life depends on it – because it does. #lagov #lalege https://t.co/mK4g2sGFdK

God bless you all, God bless the United States of America, and God bless the great state of Louisiana. #lagov #lalege

I am as optimistic as ever about the future of this great state. And I look forward to forging new partnerships this session as we enter a new year, a new term, and a new chapter for Louisiana. #lagov #lalege

The people of Louisiana elected us to create positive change that will benefit generations to come. And together, there is no seed we can’t sow, especially if we continue to build on the bipartisanship that has served us so well. #lagov #lalege

Progress doesn’t happen overnight. It starts with a vision, a dream, or an idea. Sometimes, it starts with a single bill. And then over time what began as a seed of faith will grow as tall and strong as an oak tree, outlasting all of us here today. #lagov #lalege https://t.co/MrntOIrtxj

Earlier in my remarks, I mentioned the oak tree at the Governor’s Mansion that bears the phrase, “Tall oaks from little acorns grow.” It’s a powerful & accurate way to describe the importance of education. But it also holds true to the work we do in this building. #lagov #lalege

Starting this week, information will begin going out to homes on how to participate. We all know that it is vital for everyone to be counted because of the direct impact it has on their lives and our ability to serve them in the best possible way. #lagov #lalege
Something else I am hopeful that we can all find common ground on is encouraging all residents to participate in the 2020 census. #lagov #lalege
If in addition to real insurance reform you want to pursue other efforts, I am willing to sit down with you and discuss with a goal of finding common ground. #lagov #lalege
Making these changes to avoid discrimination in the setting of insurance rates is the common sense thing to do, but more importantly, it’s the right thing to do. #lagov #lalege

We have 130 guardsmen currently mobilized, and we are about to have nearly 2,000 more deployed at the end of the year. And we should do everything in our power to make sure they are not penalized when they return. #lagov #lalege

I think we can all agree that our auto insurance rates should be based on our driving records. Not on if you’re female, or poor, or widowed, or putting your life on the line for our country. These bills would prohibit penalties based on those factors. #lagov #lalege

Here’s a list of factors that auto insurance companies can currently use to legally increase your rates:

As I’ve often said, this is the new normal in Louisiana and across the globe. In Louisiana, I want our “new normal” to be the highest level of cybersecurity defense of any state in the nation. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020
In Louisiana, we are accustomed to the dangers of water and wind. But the newest threat we face is the hacking of our public and private computer systems. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

And I am excited to report that over the next 4 years, for the first time in history, we will break ground on projects that will restore more land than we expect to lose. God created the Sportsman’s Paradise, but he has charged us with taking care of it. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

And just as important is protecting our way of life, which is why we must continue to aggressively fight for coastal restoration. Right now the largest number and most significant coastal protection and restoration projects in state history. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

As our economy grows, so must the quality and capacity of our roads and bridges. With a backlog of 14.6 billion dollars, we must continue to pursue every means available to us in order to deliver safer and more efficient infrastructure. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

We can do this by building on programs we already have in place, expanding dual enrollment opportunities & partnering with business and industry leaders. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020 https://t.co/i8vED1Gu1u

This brings me to my next second term priority – workforce development. As we continue to diversify our economy, I want to ensure that Louisiana’s workforce is the most job ready in the nation. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

But we can’t stop there. I will continue to advocate for equal pay for equal work. Because when women succeed, families succeed, and when families succeed so does Louisiana.  #lagov #lalege #JBE2020 https://t.co/T3ftNTbJLq

Speaking of pay raises, we also know that $7.25 an hour is not a meaningful wage in 2020. It wasn’t acceptable four years ago either, which is why I have fought for our workers every year. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

We are also going to better fund every level of education. Over the next four years, we’re going to continue increasing classroom funding and give educators additional pay raises that will get them to at least the Southern regional average. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

We know that education is the key to economic opportunity and that a pathway to prosperity must begin at the earliest stages of life. That is why the highest priority for new investments in education of my second term will be early childhood education. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

But today isn't just about past successes. I want to challenge the people of Louisiana to envision a state with a fully diversified economy, a steady reduction in poverty statistics and an educational system that keeps our future leaders here at home. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

The primary reason we have been able to make so much progress is because we chose not to let the dysfunctional, hyper-partisan politics of Washington D.C. paralyze our state. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020 https://t.co/4ay20FhPGS

We have also changed lives by putting our differences aside to pass historic criminal justice reforms and drastically reduce our state’s incarceration rate, while at the same time making our communities safer and better supporting victims of crime. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

And as promised, on my first full day in office, we expanded Medicaid to the working poor of Louisiana. Four years later, over 450,000 people have healthcare and our uninsured rate has been cut by more than half to the lowest in history. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

Also because of our fiscal stability and economic growth, we made the first net new investment in higher education in 10 years and gave our teachers and support workers their first pay raise in a decade. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

And another clear sign of progress. Just last week, the nonpartisan Bureau of Economic Analysis announced that Louisiana has the 4th fastest growing economy in the nation. In fact, our economy is the largest it has ever been. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020 https://t.co/7x2c25aqjy

Because of the work we put in over the last 4 years, Louisiana has achieved economic stability and growth and is stronger because of it. We found common ground in order to solve the fiscal crisis and we are now operating with surpluses instead of deficits.#lagov #lalege #JBE2020 https://t.co/x3Qr11HxlC

But Louisiana is stronger than any storm that comes our way. Powered by our diverse cultures and backgrounds, we are Louisiana strong and Louisiana proud. Time and time again we have proven that there’s nothing we can’t accomplish when we work together. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020
Four years ago, when I stood on these steps, our state was at a precipice. We faced a $2 billion budget deficit, the largest in our state’s history.  #lagov #lalege #JBE2020

That great breeze of hope I spoke about from this very spot in 2016 that we all felt on that crisp January day has been with us ever since. It has grown stronger with each passing year, inspiring us to do better and to be better, moving Louisiana forward. #lagov #lalege #JBE2020
